snippet: The weeklong fast outside Parliament is the latest protest against the policies of Hungary’s prime minister, who has been accused of undermining the country’s young democracy.
abstract: Hungarians stage a weeklong fast in Budapest to protest the policies of Prime Min Viktor Orban, who has been accused of undermining the country's young democracy; immediate issue is a proposal requiring voters to register at least 15 days in advance of an election, a practice that opponents say would give the ruling party a big advantage and would be vulnerable to manipulation.
lead_paragraph: The weeklong fast outside Parliament is the latest protest against the policies of Hungary’s prime minister, who has been accused of undermining the country’s young democracy.

headline.seo: Hungarians Hold Hunger Strike Over Voting Changes
headline.main: Hungarians Stage a Fast Over Rules for Voters
headline.print_headline: Hungarians Stage a Fast Over Rules For Voters
